content: How can I easily determine which version of Flask is installed on my system?

To determine which version of Flask is installed on your system, you can use one of the following methods:

1. **Using the Command Line:**
   Open your terminal or command prompt and run the following command:

   ```bash
   flask --version
   ```

   This will display the version of Flask that is currently installed.

2. **Using Python:**
   You can also check the version of Flask from within a Python script or an interactive Python session. Open your Python interpreter and run:

   ```python
   import flask
   print(flask.__version__)
   ```

   This will print the version number of the installed Flask package.

3. **Using pip:**
   You can also use `pip` to check the installed version. Run the following command in your terminal:

   ```bash
   pip show flask
   ```

   This command will provide detailed information about the Flask package, including its version.

These methods will help you easily determine which version of Flask is installed on your system.
